text.author: Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia
text.title: Antonin Dvorak
text.summary: Antonín Dvořák was a 19th Century Romantic-era Czech composer who enjoyed great success in Russia, Germany, the UK and the US, teaching in both the US and Prague, and best known for Dumky Trio, the Symphony From the New World, Cello Concerto and his opera Rusalka.
text.summary2: Antonín Dvořák is a Czech composer who received world-wide recognition for his works of versatile symphonies and operas that conveyed themes ranging from Czech national spirit to folk romantic rhythms.
